definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes
on call/always available/ready at all times
lit. to set up a separate kitchen (idiom); to start from scratch/back to square one/to start of on a new path
to regard it as an honor (idiom)
One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
forced labor (as punishment in criminal case)
lit. to draw a gourd from the model (idiom)/fig. to copy sth mechanically without attempt at originality
(coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
